title: Eminem's daughter Hailie, 23, sparks engagement rumours with cryptic Instagram post
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Eminem's daughter Hailie Mathers, 23, has prompted rumours she's engaged.

She posted a photo of herself dressed up as singer Airana Grande for Halloween , posing in Ariana's trademark hoodie and knee high boots.

She captioned the photo with a series of diamond ring emojis and nothing else, which had her followers wondering if she had some big news.

One fan wrote: "Please don't tell me you are engaged."

Another questioned: "Are you engaged???"

However, it's more likely that the emojis were just a tribute to Ariana's song Seven Rings.

(Image: iNSTAGRAM)

(Image: iNSTAGRAM)

Pop princess Ariana herself commented on the photo with some diamond ring emojis of her own in appreciation of the post.

Hailie, whose dad is famous rapper Eminem, real name Marshall Mathers, boasts an impressive 1.7million followers on Instagram .

Her mother is Kim Scott, who Eminem married twice during their on/off relationship.

(Image: WENN)

(Image: Instagram)

He has referenced Hailie in several of his songs, including Mockingbird, Hailie's Song, and When I'm Gone.

Reports recently surfaced that Eminem was questioned by the Secret Service over violent lyrics about Ivanka Trump in his song Framed.

Ivanka Trump is the 37-year-old daughter of US president Donald Trump .

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images for Rag)

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Enimem, real name Marshall Mathers, released the song in 2017, and it contains the lyric: "How the f**k is Ivanka Trump in the trunk of my car?"

He then calls her a "dumb little blonde" and says she "got dumped in the pond".

It's reported that agents visited the rapper and interviewed him in January 2018, but no further action was taken.
description: Hailie Mathers, 23, caused fans to speculate that she was engaged due to her choice of emojis
authors: Dave Benett Getty Images For Rag
